criterion: Reward for overall completeness of the note relative to the transcript, accurately reflecting all major patient statements, clinician questions, answers, and expressed plans
Reward for accurately documenting the patient’s report that joint pain has become more intense and that she worries adding hydroxychloroquine may not be enough
Reward for capturing the clinician’s inquiry about any improvement since starting hydroxychloroquine and the patient’s response of only slight, variable benefit

Reward for documenting the clinician’s explanation that variable response is typical in RA and that they may wait a bit longer but will consider dose adjustment or alternative therapies if pain persists
Reward for recording the clinician’s commitment to monitor closely in response to the patient’s concern about waiting too long
Reward for noting the clinician’s question about daily folic-acid use and the patient’s confirmation of adherence
Reward for including the patient’s comment that a support group helps her stay on the medication regimen

Reward for listing current RA-related medications (methotrexate 15 mg weekly, hydroxychloroquine 200 mg daily, folic acid 1 mg daily) and the existing rheumatoid arthritis diagnosis, using the chart only for facts explicitly relevant to the encounter

Penalize for introducing or omitting key elements of the therapeutic discussion, such as documenting an actual dose change that was only discussed as a possibility, or failing to mention the monitoring plan
Penalize for fabricating new diagnoses, medications, orders, or history items that are not present in either the transcript or relevant portions of the chart

Penalize for selectively or inaccurately copying chart details (e.g., unrelated allergies, family history, or conditions) that were not referenced in the conversation and do not clarify discussed items
